meanings.definition: The state or quality of being nebulous or cloudy.
meanings.sent1: The nebulosity of the sky made it difficult to see the stars.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the nebulosity of the clouds in their painting.
meanings.sent3: The nebulosity of the situation left everyone feeling confused.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was filled with a nebulosity of thoughts, swirling and shifting.
meanings.sent5: The nebulosity of the fog enveloped the entire town in a mysterious haze.

meanings.definition: Something that is nebulous or hazy in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The nebulosity outline of the mountain faded into the mist.
meanings.sent2: Her memories of the dream were nebulosity and unclear.
meanings.sent3: The nebulosity glass made everything look distorted and strange.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a nebulosity veil, hiding his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The nebulosity figure in the distance seemed to dance in the foggy light.

meanings.definition: The presence of nebulous or indistinct elements.
meanings.sent1: The nebulosity in the photograph added a dreamy quality to the image.
meanings.sent2: The nebulosity of the music created a sense of mystery and intrigue.
meanings.sent3: The nebulosity of the recipe made it challenging to follow.
meanings.sent4: The nebulosity of the crowd made it hard to distinguish individuals.
meanings.sent5: The nebulosity of the forest at night gave it an eerie and otherworldly feel.
